Examples¶

In this section, we present illustrative examples for importing files serialized with CSD model using csdmpy package. Because CSD model allows multi-dimensional datasets with multiple dependent variables, we use a shorthand notation of \(d\mathrm{D}\{p\}\) to indicate that a dataset has \(p\)-component dependent variable defined on a \(d\)-dimensional coordinate grid. In the case of correlated datasets, the number of components in each dependent variable is given as a list within the curly braces, i.e., \(d\mathrm{D}\{p_0, p_1, p_2, ...\}\).

For the following examples, you can download the corresponding files here.

Example Dataset

  • Scalar, 1D{1} datasets
    • Global Mean Sea Level rise dataset
    • Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (MNR) dataset
    • Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR) dataset
    • Gas Chromatography dataset
    • Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy (FTIR) dataset
    • Ultraviolet–visible (UV-vis) dataset
    • Mass spectrometry dataset
  • Scalar, 2D{1} datasets
    • Astronomy dataset
    • Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) dataset
    • Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) dataset
  • Vector, 2D{2} datasets
    • Vector dataset
  • Pixel, 2D{3} datasets
    • Image datasets
  • Correlated Dataset
    • Meteorological, 2D{1,1,2,1,1} dataset
    • Astronomy, 2D{1,1,1} dataset (Creating image composition)
      • Image composition
  • Labeled Dataset
